image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price speaks at a podium at the National Press Club

items.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price tells the National Press Club the Voice to Parliament proposal is "flawed in its foundations".

title.children: 'I will not accept the lie': Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price rails against the Voice in Press Club address

image.altText: An activist holds a banner reading 'Middle Arm Risks Health' and 'Our Children Need A Safe Climate'

items.synopsis: A United Nations expert warns three major NT oil and gas projects will "threaten to make Darwin and the region a climate change sacrifice zone".

title.children: UN expert warns NT Middle Arm project will raise risk of cancer, heart disease and asthma

image.altText: Four men in high vis stand next to a truck in smoky conditions

items.synopsis: A group of volunteer firefighters and extra vehicles from South Australia will help protect the town from a fire raging to the east, as well as a separate fire threatening communities to the south.

title.children: Interstate crews arrive in Tennant Creek as bushfires threaten remote communities

image.altText: A sign for the Alice Springs Hospital, out the front of the healthcare facility

items.synopsis: Police said a 48-year-old woman was walking along Gap Road in front of Alice Springs Hospital before 9pm when she was struck on the road by a driver who left the scene before handing himself in.

title.children: Call for witnesses after pedestrian killed outside Alice Springs Hospital by driver who 'left the scene'

image.altText: Job ads in a newspaper.

items.synopsis: The unemployment rate remained at 3.7 per cent in August, as 65,000 people found work and official unemployment fell slightly.

title.children: Cost of living pressures drive record number of people into labour market as unemployment rate stays steady

image.altText: Sussan Ley stands next to Peter Dutton as he speaks in front of a blue curtain, an Australian flag is behind them

items.synopsis: Australians receiving text messages from the No campaign are being sent a link to sign up for a postal vote in the upcoming referendum that directs them to a Liberal Party website.

title.children: Sussan Ley says Liberals are not running No campaign with mass distribution of text messages questioned

image.altText: A burnt out plastic box on the side of a brick wall outside.

items.synopsis: A spike in fires caused by DC isolators has alarmed the NT's workplace safety watchdog, as figures show most other jurisdictions are also recording fires from the devices.

title.children: Why one small component on your rooftop solar panels is causing a rise in housefires

image.altText: A forensics worker in a white suit at a crime scene at a house

items.synopsis: Police are still establishing whether two public-place shootings in Sydney in two days are linked.

title.children: Man gunned down in 'ambush-style attack' outside his Western Sydney home

image.altText: Albanese gestures to his colleagues while they all wear high vis vests and

items.synopsis: The $10 billion Housing Australia Future Fund has passed parliament, paving the way for new social and affordable homes to be built.

title.children: The government's $10bn housing bill has passed parliament, paving way for 30,000 new homes

image.altText: ​​​​​​​ Beachgoers lie on their towels on Tamarama beach during a hot spring day in Sydney, Australia, 2015

items.synopsis: Some parts of Australia could face temperatures up to 16 degrees Celsius above average as a prolonged, unseasonal spell of hot weather sets in over the next week.

title.children: South-east Australia set to bake as hot spring weather soars up to 16 degrees above average

image.altText: A person in high-vis clothes walks past large barrels in the outback.

items.synopsis: The people behind the world's biggest radio telescope being constructed in WA's Murchison region say it's a hectic but exciting time as works finally begin on the ground.

title.children: In outback Western Australia, the 'world's largest science project' is taking shape

image.altText: A small, shrivelled humanoid-like figure lying in a wooden box

items.synopsis: A well-known UFO enthusiast unveiled two tiny, grey bodies during a Mexican congress hearing on UFOs, claiming they are evidence of "non-human" beings. But the claims don't stack up.

title.children: The discovery of an 'alien corpse' is all over the internet. What's really going on?

image.altText: An eastern brown snake curled on the ground

items.synopsis: The 68-year-old was struck multiple times in the chest and arms as he removed the snake and took it away from others at the celebration.

title.children: Snakebite ruled out as cause of death of beloved grandfather as coroner finds no venom in system

image.altText: A man poses with an Apple iPhone 12 in a mobile phone store in Nantes, France, September 13, 2023

items.synopsis: France's radiation watchdog claims tests on two iPhone 12s showed they breached European radiation exposure limits.

title.children: France has banned the sale of iPhone 12s over 'failed radiation tests'. What does this mean for Australians?

image.altText: Woman in street with red microphone talks to man with sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The man allegedly groped the Madrid reporter before interrupting her broadcast, leading politicians to condemn the "absolutely intolerable situation".

title.children: Spanish man arrested after 'machismo' grope of journalist live on air

image.altText: Rescuers carry a dead body down a street with destroyed buildings on both sides

items.synopsis: Residents of the devastated Libyan city of Derna are desperately searching for missing relatives, and rescue workers are appealing for more body bags, after a catastrophic flood that has killed thousands of people and swept many out to sea.

title.children: Libyans search for relatives missing in flood as 20,000 feared dead in Derna

image.altText: a greyhound standing in a field

items.synopsis: A Chinese dog buyer has lifted the lid on the extraordinary world of exporting Australian racing greyhounds to China, where their offspring are used to grow the country’s illegal gambling industry.

title.children: Australian greyhound Katoby disappeared after retirement. We found him on a Chinese breeding site

image.altText: a 10-year-old girl wearing earrings and makeup

items.synopsis: Three family members of a 10-year-old girl found dead at her home in England have been arrested more than a month after leaving the country for Pakistan.

title.children: Sara Sharif's father, stepmother, uncle arrested month after 10yo's body found

image.altText: people cross the street on a busy city street

items.synopsis: The local share market rose almost half a per cent as unemployment data showed 65,000 jobs were added in August. Iron ore miners had a strong day, but Myer stock lost value despite posting its best annual sales result since 2005.

title.children: Jobless rate steady for second-straight month, shares close higher thanks to rising iron ore prices, Myer reports best sales in 18 years — as it happened

image.altText: An AFL player in a black training shirt, catches a football

items.synopsis: AFL boss Gillon McLachlan defends the tribunal process but says the league is "duty bound" to consider rule changes after Collingwood's Brayden Maynard had his rough conduct charge thrown out.

title.children: AFL 'duty bound' to review rules in Maynard case, McLachlan says

image.altText: A group of 10 family members walking outside a court building

items.synopsis: A drunk driver who killed a grandfather after crashing into his tractor and pinning him under his vehicle on a semi-rural property in Adelaide's north is sentenced to more than six years in jail.

title.children: Drink driver who killed grandfather in 'unimaginably traumatic' crash sentenced

image.altText: An F1 driver in an orange shirt and cap, sits in his team garage during a session

items.synopsis: Singapore will provide the latest challenge in 22-year-old Oscar Piastri's short career, with the track one of the most physically demanding on the calendar.

title.children: F1 rookie Piastri looking forward to race where 'anything can happen', Ricciardo returns to pit wall

image.altText: A man wears a mask while walking through Sydney's CBD

items.synopsis: Sydney's air quality on Thursday morning was the worst it has been since smoke from this week's hazard-reduction burns began blanketing the city.

title.children: Doctors report spike in respiratory issues as Sydney experiences 'very poor' air quality due to lingering smoke

image.altText: protesters close

items.synopsis: Thousands of construction workers rallying on the streets of Brisbane say a broken workplace health and safety system is putting them and the public at risk.

title.children: 'Blood on the concrete': Call for overhaul of workplace safety system as thousands protest in Brisbane

image.altText: Darren Culleton smiles, dressed in a grey top and black beanie.

items.synopsis: Coroner David Ryan says police had "clearly not followed" custody management procedures on February 5, 2021, when they kept Darren Ricky Culleton, 31, inside a divisional van for 48 minutes.

title.children: Victorian man's death after choking in police van a 'preventable tragedy', coroner finds

image.altText: Hand cradling a cup of coffee

items.synopsis: How does caffeine work in your body, how much can you have and is there a best time of the day to drink it? We explore the science behind your morning brew.

title.children: Want more 'bang for your cup?' Science says this is the best time to drink your morning brew

image.altText: A large pile of rubble, with mountains visible in the background.

items.synopsis: In the days since a deadly earthquake rippled through Morocco's High Atlas Mountain, devastating stories of loss have emerged. Seismic data and satellite imagery show the sheer scale of this destruction.

title.children: Deep in the Atlas Mountains, a monster was slowly growing. Moroccan villages on top had no chance

image.altText: A composite image of a fuel drum standing next to a crate.

items.synopsis: Drug trafficking is usually left to the streets of capital cities. But this consignment found its way to a small, idyllic rural Australian town.

title.children: $100 million meth tracked to tiny regional town after US Homeland Security alerts AFP

image.altText: A close-up picture of Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews looking thoughtful.

items.synopsis: The Victorian Ombudsman has criticised the Andrews government's inaction on implementing anti-corruption measures, saying it has shown few "signs of life" on key recommendations made a year ago.

title.children: Ombudsman says Victorian government's efforts to address corruption 'not good enough'

image.altText: A man fills his car with petrol.

items.synopsis: Surging fuel prices reignite fears about inflation as production cuts by a global oil cartel heap yet more pain on consumers at service station forecourts.

title.children: Fuel prices to stay above $2 a litre in 'bitter pill' for consumers facing fresh inflation fears

image.altText: An older man wearing a navy blue polo shirt leans against a pillar outside his home wearing sunglasses with his arms folded.

items.synopsis: As former Qantas workers celebrate their historic victory over the airline in the High Court, an industrial relations lawyer says any compensation bill or financial penalty won't affect Qantas' bottom line — or stop it from outsourcing jobs in the future.

title.children: Qantas workers were 'put through hell', but the airline likely won't be hurt financially

image.altText: Michaelia Cash in front of a green background

items.synopsis: The federal Coalition will try to overturn the ACT's drug-decriminalisation policy, which reduces penalties for people possessing small amounts of illicit drugs, including cocaine, ice and heroin.

title.children: 'This is madness': Federal opposition will seek to overturn ACT's new drug laws

image.altText: Danny and Jess sitting on the couch with their pet dog.

items.synopsis: One-punch victim Danny Hodgson launches a furious broadside at WA's justice system, as it emerges the teenager convicted of attacking him has been arrested over another alleged violent crime.

title.children: 'It's a miserable life': Danny Hodgson gives up on dream of having kids as his attacker is charged with another offence

image.altText: A white man with brown hair and a checked shirt stands in lush, green grape vines with a cheeky, full smile.

items.synopsis: A 97-page report into rural mental health reveals there are just 19.3 full time positions in SA's rural psychiatry workforce, most of them based in Adelaide, with just three living in a rural community.

title.children: 'A broken system': Damning review into SA mental health services after Theo's preventable death

image.altText: A cruiseship sits in the water with snow-capped mountains in the background

items.synopsis: A fishing trawler's attempt to free a luxury cruise ship that ran aground two days ago in a remote part of Greenland has failed, leaving the vessel and the 206 people on board still stranded.

title.children: Trawler fails to free luxury cruise ship grounded in Greenland with 85 Australians on board
